1.0: "Listen" - to the message he gives, that addresses all in whose nostrils G-d (lit. hashem, the name) blew the breath of life. Therefore, "listen all who dwell on Earth".

0.0: "To the conductor, listen to this all nations" - this psalm is very important, because it explains the light of the afterlife (lit. World to come) and the undying soul of wisdom.

3.1: And "thoughts and insights" - that my heart thought.
3.0: "My mouth" - to teach all the wisdom hidden from them, which those wise of heart explain by riddles.

2.0: "Also" - calling the sons of Adam who aren't wealthy, or who are and are well known. That is the reason for also having "sons of man", to include the rich and the poor.

9.0: "And he shall live" - that is how he who works to gain treasure thinks

11.1: . . .Kiss the son against his anointed; and behold the interpretation 'How pure and also how pure my insides' (Proverbs 31:2); and it is also written 'you are my son.' It is a custom in the nations of the world to place their hands under the hand of the king as the brother of Solomon or the slave under the thigh of his master or to kiss the king. This is the custom in India to this day.
11.0: Kiss the son - Behold and serve the Lord in contrast to. . .

18.0: He who was rescued, he is obligated to thank Him. This is righteousness.

1.0: "Thank the God of gods" - the God of the high angels, who don't have bodies [and are therefore called gods].

2.0: "Thank the Lord of lords" - the angels are the lords of the earth.

1.0: "Who stand" - those are the priests who perform the sacrifices and those who play the trumpets

0.0: Why does it say "from the depth"? Because of the depth of poverty and low status in the diaspora.
